results.title: All at sea; Film fun
results.creator_credit: Maurice Sellar, Robert Sidaway and Rank Film Distributors
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Best of British”.
All at sea focuses on the fine English tradition for “messing about in boats.” This episode explores action on the high sea from intrepid explorers like Columbus to heroes in submarines, as well as those heroic sea sagas and comic “fun on the ocean waves” films. “Film fun” highlights the visual comedy from Britain’s rich source of comedians such as Norman Wisdom, Frankie Howard, Peter Sellers and the Carry On crew who demonstrate the art of immaculate timing and pure visual technique. Narrated by Sir John Mills.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maurice Sellar, Robert Sidaway and Rank Film Distributors

results.title: All around us: radiation
results.creator_credit: Gerard Holdsworth Productions and Derek Cunningham
results.brief_description: Explains radiation, how it was discovered and how it is measured. Considers its applications and possible effects on health. Shows how radiation is used to our benefit in industry, medicine and research.
results.description: Explains radiation, how it was discovered and how it is measured. Considers its applications and possible effects on health. Shows how radiation is used to our benefit in industry, medicine and research.

results.title: All America roses
results.brief_description: Shows how rose growers throughout the United States compete for the label “All-America-Rose” selection. Shows the checking of blooms at test stations where the best roses are brought to perfection; close-up studies of different varieties of roses; the use of roses in landscape gardening and interior decoration. Narrated by Peter Allen.

results.title: All about weightlessness: the astronaut's dilemma
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: Dr Heinz Haber uses a specially created cartoon character, Homo-Sapiens-Extrater-Restrialis, to explain the hazards of survival in the strange environment of outer space. Man must become conditioned to living in a state of weightlessness for long periods. Eating presents some new and surprising problems; sleeping will be a unique experience. We do not know how man’s subconscious mind will react to prolonged journeying through space. An excerpt from “Man in space”.

results.title: All about ships
results.creator_credit: South Australia. Dept. of Education and George Klein
results.brief_description: An animated film depicting the evolution of ships from the log raft to the development of the nuclear powered vessel. This story of ships includes the early problems of navigation and ship building and portrays human endeavours to improve sea transport in all parts of the world.

results.title: All about music
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Farmhouse Films and Fred Calvert
results.brief_description: Provides, through the use of animation, an introduction to the origins and basic elements of music. Tells the story of a caveman and his discovery of rhythm, melody, and harmony. Highlights, with live action inserts, prehistoric contributions to the development of music, including modern music.

results.title: All about L.O.T.E.: languages other than English
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Can you speak a LOTE? Most students in Victorian schools are learning one. There are many ways of teaching it and many kinds of learners. This program shows students at schools around Melbourne learning and talking about Languages Other Than English.

results.title: All about kids
results.brief_description: Quebec Aquarium: School children see marine life at close range. Children’s Play Therapy: Games and handicrafts are considered an important part of a young patient’s recovery at Children’s Hospital in Winnipeg. Soccer School: British coach Trevor Churchill adds to the already active interest in this sport in British Columbia.

results.title: All about Eve
results.creator_credit: Vincent Burke, TopShelf Productions and Monique Oomen
results.brief_description: The powerful and moving story of Eve van Grafthorst who died of AIDS at the age of 11 in November 1993. Born 3 months premature, Eve contracted HIV through a blood transfusion to save her life. This documentary is a tribute to an extraordinary child who was determined to tell her story, her perspective on life, death, love, friends, family, AIDS and God. The film includes archival footage and reflects Eve’s constant battle against the disease, the prejudices associated with AIDS and of her constant drive to educate the public and support her friends with AIDS.

results.title: All about Bobby
results.creator_credit: Brad Stanley and Arthur Barr Productions
results.brief_description: Clearly, no one knows about twelve-year-old Bobby Ramirez, although each person questioned has their own opinion and impression of the boy. All of those impressions, and others are voice over film clips which show him going about his regular activities and refuting right and left views of the people who think they know him. A stimulating film which leads to an investigation into what and who each of us is.
